definition: gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: Residents gather for a morning prayer.
sentences.chinese: 看护之家的成员们聚在一起做晨间祷告。

sentences.english: Delusions of knowledge are like the fog of the morning.
sentences.chinese: 而常识的幻影却不过如晨间之雾。

sentences.english: Morning activity in outdoor game, we are playing very happy.
sentences.chinese: 晨间活动在进行户外游戏时，大家都玩得非常开心。

sentences.english: Delusions of knowledge are like the fog of the morning。
sentences.chinese: 而知识的幻影却不过如晨间之雾。

sentences.english: My morning coat, my collar mounting firmly to the chin.
sentences.chinese: 我晨间的大衣，衣领稳稳地攀至下颚。

sentences.english: It says cloudy in the morning, but it'll clear up early in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说晨间多雾，不过下午很早就会放晴。

definition: in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
first thing in the morning/at daybreak
to ease (tension)/to relax/to cause sth to relax/to alleviate/relaxed/easy and unhurried/leisurely/soothing/mild (slope)
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
Chunri or Chunjih township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
first rays of morning sun/first glimmer of dawn
